description: Borrowed from Latin rēctus (“straight, upright”), clipping of mūsculus rēctus (“straight muscle”).

definitionGroups.group: (anatomy) Any of several straight muscles in various parts of the body, as of the abdomen, thigh, eye etc.

entries.meaning: (anatomy) Any of a number of muscles controlling the movement of the eyeball.
examples: Hyponyms: superior rectus, inferior rectus, medial rectus, lateral rectus
